name: Discover
purpose: Spark curiosity and teach mezcal diversity through visual intrigue. The viewer should feel like they’ve uncovered something: a species, a texture, a place, a detail. It’s education disguised as beauty.
what_this_pillar_is: Micro-learning through imagery (no lectures, no heavy text).
Agave diversity as the hero: species, textures, environments, silhouettes.
A sense of discovery: found objects, wild landscapes, subtle clues.
what_this_pillar_is_not: How-to guidance or buying/ordering optimisation (that is Level Up).
Glossy staged product ads or sterile e-commerce packshots.

content_goals.brand_goal: Position the cards as the coolest way to explore mezcal beyond Espadín, visually and intuitively.
content_goals.audience_goal: Make mezcal-curious people feel smart and pulled in without being intimidated.
content_goals.content_goal: Create scroll-stopping images that feel like a hidden door into agave worlds.

visual_story_rules.core_rule: Every Discover image must contain a hook detail that makes you look twice.
composition_bias: product as a discovery artefact, not a billboard
hook_types_ranked: shadow silhouette revealing an agave form
cards interacting with wind or dust or terrain
agave textures cropped like abstract art
subtle sense of place (rocky hillside, field edge)
a micro clue prop (salt dish, citrus peel, fibre strand)

intensity_bands.label: museum calm
intensity_bands.discover_behaviour: stillness and clarity, minimal props, crisp geometry

intensity_bands.label: social-ready subtle
intensity_bands.discover_behaviour: gentle movement, wind and dust, light interaction

intensity_bands.label: kinetic but controlled
intensity_bands.discover_behaviour: stronger wind cues, slightly more drama, still readable

intensity_bands.label: controlled chaos (Discover-safe)
intensity_bands.discover_behaviour: maximum drama without clutter, never messy social energy

sub_modes.name: Species reveal
sub_modes.intent: Reveal one agave species like a secret being uncovered.
hook_patterns_still: one card as the key, species silhouette as the reveal
clean mystery: the shadow tells the story
a single discovery artefact in perfect light
hook_patterns_video: first frame: crisp shadow silhouette with card as key, then slow shadow rotation
first frame: card locked, light shifts to reveal agave shape
moment_templates_still: A single face card sits inside a crisp agave shadow silhouette.
The card is perfectly grounded while the agave shadow shape reveals the species form.
Minimal set: card plus shadow geometry, nothing else competing.
moment_templates_video: First frame: card is sharp and centred with a clear agave shadow. After frame 1: the light source shifts slowly and the shadow slides across the surface.
First frame: still composition. After frame 1: shadow rotates subtly like a sundial reveal.
prop_logic: one fibre strand as a clue

sub_modes.name: Terroir evidence
sub_modes.intent: Make place and geology feel tangible through texture and material truth.
hook_patterns_still: cards feel found outdoors, not placed
rock, grit, and sun-baked texture do the talking
hook_patterns_video: first frame: card sharp on raw terrain, then dust drifts across the surface
first frame: locked composition, then wind nudges one corner
moment_templates_still: Cards lie on rocky ground with a hint of agave nearby, dust catching the light.
One card corner is lifted slightly as if wind just touched it.
A single card is half-buried in soil beside agave fibres.
moment_templates_video: First frame: card is sharp on rocky terrain. After frame 1: dust drifts across the card, one corner lifts and settles.
First frame: still. After frame 1: grit moves subtly like a passing breeze.

sub_modes.name: Comparative tasting
sub_modes.intent: Teach difference by pairing without feeling instructional.
hook_patterns_still: two cards imply contrast, one copita anchors the scene
quiet comparison, no busy tasting flight setup
hook_patterns_video: first frame: two cards and one copita, then a hand nudges one card into alignment
first frame: still. After frame 1: a slow rack focus between cards
moment_templates_still: Two face cards lie slightly offset like an A/B comparison, a small copita sits near the join.
One card has dust, the other is cleaner, implying environmental contrast.
Macro crop focuses on texture differences while cards remain true scale.
moment_templates_video: First frame: two cards and a copita in clean composition. After frame 1: subtle rack focus from card 1 to card 2.
First frame: still. After frame 1: a hand gently slides one card 1 cm into alignment.
prop_logic: salt dish as a micro clue only

sub_modes.name: Maker’s hands
sub_modes.intent: Human presence as context only, never social or portrait-led.
hook_patterns_still: hands as quiet context, like an artefact study
hook_patterns_video: first frame: still study table, then a hand places a copita down gently
first frame: calm, then fingers adjust one card edge by millimetres
moment_templates_still: A quiet timber table scene: a face card, agave object, and hands just entering frame.
Hands hold the card delicately, showing scale and texture.
Warm light, calm composition, no faces.
moment_templates_video: First frame: study-table still life is sharp and readable. After frame 1: a hand places a copita down gently without splash.
First frame: locked. After frame 1: fingers adjust the card edge slightly, dust shifts.
prop_logic: warm lamp or window edge light
blurred notebook with no readable writing
matchbook or small object only if it feels found

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Shadows
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: A single card and a sharp agave shadow that reveals different species.
scene_rules: Minimal set with strong shadow geometry
Card stays crisp and true scale
Shadow must clearly read as agave rosette or spears

from_marketing_plan.title: Deck in the Wild
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Cards feel found outdoors: dust, wind, terrain, real environment.
scene_rules: Cards are imperfectly placed, not staged

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Origami
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Agave as obsession: sculptural, folded, studied, collected.
scene_rules: Craftsmanship feel: timber table, clay wall, warm light
Hands can appear but not faces

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Facts
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Extreme close crops of agave textures paired with a single card as the key.
scene_rules: Card is small and secondary but readable

people_and_framing.primary_rule: Discover should feel observational, not social. Humans are rare and peripheral.

face_rule.rule: No faces in Discover. If any person appears, crop or blur beyond recognition.

hand_requirements_if_present: no warped fingers or fused joints
hands remain secondary, product remains hero

continuity_locks: same number of objects and hands
same surface texture and background materials
no new labels or text appearing
mezcal remains still and never bubbly

realness_micro_specs: micro scratches in tabletop or stone
fingerprints and smudges on glass and glossy varnish
condensation ring or faint wet mark under copita
physically accurate glass refraction and liquid meniscus
clean contact shadows under card corners and glass base
crisp card edges and consistent border thickness
brand_hard_constraints: mezcal bottle labels must be blank
poured mezcal must never be bubbly or foamy
playing cards must be accurate size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches
no text, no logos, no watermarks, no UI icons
avoid warped hands and extra fingers
negatives: no bubbles or foam in mezcal
no readable text in the scene

risky_chaotic.notes: Controlled chaos but still Discover-safe. Use wind, dust, shadow movement, not social mess.

ultra_minimal_hero.notes: Museum-grade single subject hero. Strong negative space.
